dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIGroundStation

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DJIInspireGroundStation, DJIPhantomGroundStation

    public class DJIGroundStation
extends DJIObject

    DJI Ground Station Base Class

    Before you use the API of GroundStation, you should make sure that you have the SDK-LEVEL-2 key so that the authority would allow you to invoke the API.

    DJIGroundStation class would provide a series of operations for controlling the drone. It could satisfy your requirement of manually controlling the drone by app, set up a cruise.

    For further understanding the API of ground station, we provide a guideline for operating. Please note that during the execution of ground station, no more additional way points could be uploaded to the drone.

    Step1 :openGroundStation() for opening the ground station so that the connection between app and drone could be set up.
    Step2 :uploadGroundStationTask() for uploading the tasks which the customers required to do.
    Step3 :startGroundStationTask() to send a signal for starting the tasks.
    Step4 :pauseGroundStationTask() for pausing tasks from the ground station. All of the message will be saved until the resumeGroundStationTask() is invoked.
    Step5 :continueGroundStationTask() for resuming tasks.
    Step6 :closeGroundStationTask() for terminating the tasks list.



    What's more, the setJoystick function requires the life cycle logically correct. There is a tutorial for constructing the life cycle.

    private OnScreenJoystick mScreenJoystick;
    private DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack mMcuUpdateStateCallBack;
    private DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack;

    protected void onCreat(){
      //other parameters
      mScreenJoystick.setJoystickListener();
      new Thread(){
        public void run(){
          DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation(). setAircraftJoystick();
       &emsp}
      }
      mMcuUpdateStateCallBack = new();
      mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack = new();
    }

    protected void onResume(){
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().startUpdateTimer();
      DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation().startUpdateTimer();
    }

    protected void onPause(){
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().stopUpdateTimer();
      DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation().stopUpdateTimer();
    }

    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

      • DJIGroundStation

        public DJIGroundStation()

    • Method Detail

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int intervel)
        Set up and start a timer to extract information from the flight controller.

        Post condition:
        SDK will invoke a callback function, which could be set up by setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack.
        Parameters:
        intervel - The frequency of extracting information from the aircraft. Its value could not be lower than 100ms.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns the execution result. True stands for successfully starting Update timer and false stands for failure.
        See Also:
        setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack(DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack)

      • stopUpdateTimer

        public boolean stopUpdateTimer()
        Stop the timer to extract information from the flight controller.

        Post condition:
        Ground station information will not be updated anymore.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns the execution result. True stands for successfully stopping Update timer and false stands for failure.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Release ground station interface

      • openGroundStation

        public void openGroundStation(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Open ground station. Before you get start to use ground station functions please make sure that you have already open ground station.

        Precondition:
        1. The aircraft has to be in the air.
        2. Remote Controller should be in the F mode.

        Post condition:
        If "GS_Result_Successed" is returned, the aircraft can execute other Ground Station functions.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • closeGroundStation

        public void closeGroundStation(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Close ground station. If any of ground stations will not be used any longer, it's a good habit to close ground station so that there will not be any abnormal error.

        Precondition:
        The ground station has been opened.

        Post condition:
        The aircraft cannot execute any Ground Station functions.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • uploadGroundStationTask

        public void uploadGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationTask task,
                                    DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Uploads a ground station task to the aircraft.

        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. The maximum number of waypoint list is 99.
        3. No Waypoint mission is executing or paused.

        Post condition:
        1. The previous task will be replaced with the new uploaded task.
        2. You need to invoke startGroundStationTask() to start the new task.
        Parameters:
        task - Ground station task to be uploaded to the aircraft.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • downloadGroundStationTask

        public void downloadGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Downloads a ground station task from the aircraft. Can be used to check the current task.

        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. Ground Station task has been uploaded.
        3. Ground Station task has started.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • startGroundStationTask

        public void startGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Starts executing the ground station task.

        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. Ground Station task has been uploaded.

        Post condition:
        1. If the aircraft has not taken off, it will automatically take off and execute the ground station task.
        2. The first waypoint executed is related to the startWaypointIndex.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • cancelGroundStationTask

        public void cancelGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Cancel the ground station task.

        Post condition:
        The aircraft will cancel the remaining missions in the waypoints list.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • pauseGroundStationTask

        public void pauseGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Pauses execution of the ground station task.

        Post condition:
        1. The execution will be paused.
        2. Current state will be saved until the method, continueGroundStationTask, is invoke.
        3. The aircraft will hover in its current location.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • oneKeyFly

        public void oneKeyFly(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        This method was deprecated. Instead, please use startTakeoff(DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallBack) in Main Controller class.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIMainController, DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • continueGroundStationTask

        public void continueGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Continues the ground station task, if the ground station task has been paused.

        Precondition:
        The ground station task has been paused.

        Post condition:
        1.Restore the state before pausing and continue the tasks in the waypoint-list.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • goHome

        public void goHome(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Aircraft will fly back to its home location.

        Precondition:
        The home point of the aircraft must be set up at the very beginning before the drone takes off to begin executing the ground station task.

        Post condition:
        1. If the aircraft is more than 20 meters away from the home point, the aircraft will fly back to the circle area, where the home point is the center and the radius is 5 meters.
        2. If the aircraft is less than or equal to 20 meters away from the home point, the aircraft will start to land directly.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • setAircraftYawSpeed

        public void setAircraftYawSpeed(int yawSpeed,
                                DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Sets the aircraft's yaw rotation speed and it is in the Body Coordinate System.

        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. The aircraft is not currently executing a ground station task. If it is executing a ground station task, the ground station task needs to be paused.

        Post condition:
        The direction of the aircraft pointing in the horizontal plane in changed.
        Parameters:
        yawSpeed - Yaw speed can be set in the range of [-1000, 1000]. This value maps to [-100 degree/s, 100 degree/s].
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • setAircraftPitchSpeed

        public void setAircraftPitchSpeed(int pitchSpeed,
                                  DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Sets the aircraft's pitch rotation speed and it is in the Body Coordinate System.

        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. The aircraft is not currently executing a ground station task. If it is executing a ground station task, the ground station task needs to be paused.

        Post condition:
        Change angle of the head up or down.
        Parameters:
        pitchSpeed - Pitch speed can be set in the range of [-1000, 1000]. This value maps to [-30°, +30 °].
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • setAircraftRollSpeed

        public void setAircraftRollSpeed(int rollSpeed,
                                 DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Sets the aircraft's roll rotation speed and it is in the Body Coordinate System.

        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. The aircraft is not currently executing a ground station task. If it is executing a ground station task, the ground station task needs to be paused.

        Post condition:
        Change angle of the wings up or down.
        Parameters:
        rollSpeed - Roll speed can be set in the range of [-1000, 1000]. This value maps to [-30°, +30 °].
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • setAircraftThrottle

        public void setAircraftThrottle(int throttle,
                                DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Set Aircraft Throttle and it is relative to the ground.
        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. The aircraft is not currently executing a ground station task. If it is executing a ground station task, the ground station task needs to be paused.

        Post condition:
        The aircraft goes up, goes down or stop according to the value selection.
        Parameters:
        throttle - The value must be 0, 1, or 2, where 0 means stop, 1 means up, and 2 means down.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • setAircraftJoystick

        public void setAircraftJoystick(int yawSpeed,
                                int pitchSpeed,
                                int rollSpeed,
                                int throttle,
                                DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Set's the pitch, roll, and yaw values for the aircraft's flight control. It is in the Body Coordinate System

        Precondition:
        1. Ground Station has been opened.
        2. The aircraft is not currently executing a ground station task. If it is executing a ground station task, the ground station task needs to be paused.
        3. The life cycle of DJIGroundStationExecutCallBack mCallBack should be correctly set up (You could find the set up tutorial in instruction of this class.)
        Parameters:
        yawSpeed - Yaw speed can be set in the range of [-1000, 1000]. This value maps to [-100 degrees/s, 100 degrees/s].
        pitchSpeed - Pitch speed can be set in the range of [-1000, 1000]. This value maps to [-30°, +30 °].
        rollSpeed - Roll speed can be set in the range of [-1000, 1000]. This value maps to [-30°, +30 °].
        throttle - The value must be 0, 1, or 2, where 0 means stop, 1 means up, and 2 means down.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result .
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • getYawControlMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlYawControlMode getYawControlMode()
        Get the yaw control mode. Can be Palstance Mode or Angle Mode.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Post condition:
        If you have not changed this control mode, Palstance Mode will be returned.
        Returns:
        DJINavigationFlightControlYawControlMode The enum result of yaw control mode.

      • getHorizontalControlMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlHorizontalControlMode getHorizontalControlMode()
        Get the horizontal control mode. Can be Angle Mode or Velocity Mode

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Post condition:
        If you have not changed this control mode, Angle Mode will be returned.
        Returns:
        DJINavigationFlightControlHorizontalControlMode The enum result of horizontal direction control mode.

      • getVerticalControlMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlVerticalControlMode getVerticalControlMode()
        Get the vertical control mode. Can be Velocity Mode or Position Mode.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Post condition:
        If you have not changed this control mode, Velocity Mode will be returned.
        Returns:
        DJINavigationFlightControlVerticalControlMode The enum result of vertical direction control mode.

      • getYawControlCoordinateSystem

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlCoordinateSystem getYawControlCoordinateSystem()
        Get the coordinate system. Can be Ground Coordinate System or Body Coordinate System.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Post condition:
        If you have not changed this control mode, Body Coordinate System will be returned.
        Returns:
        DJINavigationFlightControlCoordinateSystem The enum result of coordinate system

      • setYawControlMode

        public void setYawControlMode(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlYawControlMode mYawControlMode)
        Set the yaw control mode.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Post condition:
        Acts only on yaw.

        Special case:
        If the yaw control mode is set to be Angle mode, the value will be interpreted by the Ground Coordination System.
        Parameters:
        mYawControlMode - Can be set to Palstance Mode or Angle Mode. Default value is Palstance Mode.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef

      • setHorizontalControlMode

        public void setHorizontalControlMode(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlHorizontalControlMode mHorizontalControlMode)
        Set the horizontal control mode.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Post condition:
        This only acts on roll and pitch (or x and y).
        Parameters:
        mHorizontalControlMode - Can be set to Angle Mode or Velocity Mode. Default value is Angle Mode.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef

      • setVerticalControlMode

        public void setVerticalControlMode(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlVerticalControlMode mVerticalControlMode)
        Set the vertical direction control mode. It is relative to the ground.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.

        Post condition:
        Acts only on velocity in the z-axis and is not affected by the coordinate system being used.
        Parameters:
        mVerticalControlMode - Can be set to Velocity Mode or Position Mode. Default value is Velocity Mode.

      • setHorizontalControlCoordinateSystem

        public void setHorizontalControlCoordinateSystem(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJINavigationFlightControlCoordinateSystem mYawControlCoordinateSystem)
        Set the horizontal control coordination system.

        Post condition:
        This acts on the horizontal control and yaw control.
        Parameters:
        mYawControlCoordinateSystem - Can be set to Ground Coordinate System or Body Coordinate System. Default value is Body Coordinate System.

      • sendFlightControlData

        public void sendFlightControlData(float mYaw,
                                  float mPitch,
                                  float mRoll,
                                  float mThrottle,
                                  DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Send flight command to the aircraft.
        Precondition:
        1. Ground station has been open.
        2. The aircraft should not have other missions in executing.
        3. Following four modes have been set up:
        public void setHorizontalControlCoordinateSystem;
        public void setHorizontalControlMode;
        public void setVerticalControlMode;
        public void setYawControlMode.
        Parameters:
        mYaw - Different behavior in body coordinate system and in ground coordinate system.
        In the angle mode, the value falls in [-180 degrees, 180 degrees].
        In the palstance mode, the value falls in [-100 degrees/s, 100 degrees/s].
        mPitch - Different behavior in body coordinate system and in ground coordinate system.
        In the angle mode, the value falls in [-30 degrees, +30 degrees].
        In the velocity mode, the value falls in [-10 m/s, +10 m/s].
        mRoll - Different behavior in body coordinate system and in ground coordinate system.
        In the angle mode, the value falls in [-30 degrees, +30 degrees].
        In the velocity mode, the value falls in [-10 m/s, +10 m/s].
        mThrottle - Always relative to the ground.
        In the velocity mode, the value falls in [-4 m/s, 4 m/s] .
        In the position mode, the value falls in [0 m, 100 m].
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        result - Remote execute result callback.

      • getGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack

        public DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack getGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack()
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Get the callback of aircraft movement information and waypoint execution status.

        Precondition:
        setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack(DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack) has already been used.

        Post condition:
        If you are in the other activity, you can use this method to get the previous callback setting.
        Returns:
        DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack which contains the basic of flight information, such the value of pitch, roll and yaw, gps, velocity.

      • setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack

        public void setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack(DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack)
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Set the callback of aircraft movement information or waypoint execution status.
        Parameters:
        mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack - The ground station fly infomation callback.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo flyingInfo) - the flyingInfo is an instance of DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo and it contains the information of status, value of pitch and etc.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo

      • setGroundStationExecutionPushInfoCallBack

        public void setGroundStationExecutionPushInfoCallBack(DJIGroundStationExecutionPushInfoCallBack mGroundStationExecutionPushInfoCallBack)
        Set up the GroundStation Mission Push Information CallBack.
        Parameters:
        DJIGroundStationExecutionPushInfoCallBack - This call back will return the incident of way point mission status, such as execution current status and the mission uploaded is valid or not.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo flyingInfo) - the flyingInfo is an instance of DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo and it contains the information of status, value of pitch and etc.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo

      • setGroundStationMissionPushInfoCallBack

        public void setGroundStationMissionPushInfoCallBack(DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfoCallBack mGroundStationMissionPushInfoCallBack)
        Set Ground Station Mission Information CallBack.
        Parameters:
        DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfoCallBack - Return information of ground station mission. Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfo info) - the info is an instance of DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfo containing the information of ground station mission.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationMissionPushInfo

      • getDJIGroundStationTask

        public DJIGroundStationTask getDJIGroundStationTask()
        Supported only by Phantom 2 series.
        Get Ground Station Task from APP cache. This method cannot guarantee that the task is the current task executed by the aircraft. Please use downloadGroundStationTask().
        Returns:
        DJIGroundStationTask

      • resumeHotPoint

        public void resumeHotPoint(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Resume the Hot Point mission.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • cancelHotPoint

        public void cancelHotPoint(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Cancel the Hot Point mission.

        Post condition:
        The aircraft will exit the Hot Point mode.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • startHotPoint

        public void startHotPoint(DJIHotPointInitializationInfo info,
                          DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Start the Hot Point mission.

        Precondition:
        1.The Ground Station has been opened.
        2.Interest point has been set up.
        Parameters:
        info - The info is used to initialize the hot point mission. The information in info will directly determine the following sensitivity, distance, altitude and navigation mode (point to customer or remote control)
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • sendFollowTargetGps

        public void sendFollowTargetGps(DJIFollowMeTarget target,
                                DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Send the target Location before executing the Follow Me mission.
        Please keep sending GPS to the aircraft. The aircraft will stay hover, if the time interval that the aircraft cannot receive the target location is longer than 6s .
        Precondition:
        The follow me mission has not started.

        Post condition:
        The aircraft will head to the target.
        Parameters:
        target - The target position including latitude and longitude. The distance between the target and the aircraft should be within 200m.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.

      • resumeFollowMe

        public void resumeFollowMe(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Resume Follow Me mission, if it is has been paused.

        Precondition:
        1. Follow Me mission has been paused.
        2. Ground Station has been kept open.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.

      • pauseFollowMe

        public void pauseFollowMe(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Pause Follow Me mission.

        Post condition:
        All setting will be saved until the resumeFollowMe() is invoke.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.

      • cancelFollowMe

        public void cancelFollowMe(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Cancel the Follow Me mission.

        Post condition:
        The aircraft will exit the Follow Me mode.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.

      • startFollowMe

        public void startFollowMe(DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo info,
                          DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Start Follow Me mission.

        Precondition:
        1. The Ground Station has been opened.
        2. The aircraft has to be in the air. The height should be higher than 10m and lower than the height limit.
        3. Home point has been set up.
        4. No Follow Me or Waypoint mission is executing.
        5. GPS level is 5.
        6. The battery is more than 35%.
        Parameters:
        info - Follow Me mission initial information.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.

      • enterIocMode

        public void enterIocMode(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationIocType iocType,
                         DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Enter the IOC mode.

        Precondition:
        The Ground Station has opened.
        Parameters:
        iocType - Can choose IOCTypeCourseLock or IOCTypeHomeLock.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationIocType, DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • exitIocMode

        public void exitIocMode(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Exit the IOC mode.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • resetWayPointMissionFlightSpeed

        public void resetWayPointMissionFlightSpeed(float speed,
                                            DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Supported only by inspire1 and phantom3 series.
        Reset the flight speed for waypoint mission.
        Parameters:
        speed - The value should be between -15.0m/s and 15.0m/s.
        It must be smaller than the remoteControlSpeed in DJIGroundStationTask.
        During the waypoint task, when this speed is set to 0 m/s,users can adjust the speed through remote controller.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • enableFollowMeChangeHomePoint

        public void enableFollowMeChangeHomePoint(boolean enable,
                                          DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Supported only by Inspire & Phantom3 series
        Enable or disable changing home point in a Follow Me mission.
        Parameters:
        enable - True is for enable, false is for disable.
        mCallBack - Return the execution result.
        Callback interface. Implement the method onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - return the status of ground station i.e. GS_Result_Successed.
